Dave Lizewski.Action: Reflects on the universal desire to be a superhero with a calm, open attitude.
Uses humor and sarcasm to distance himself from a disturbing scene of another person’s reckless stunt.
Strikes a pose on a rooftop with mechanical wings, attempts to 'fly' but ends up falling and crashing disastrously.
Calmly prepares to attempt flight rather than panic initially, indicating some level of confidence.
Waves to his father before going to school.
Observes others around him without judgment, reflects on himself in a neutral, self-deprecating way.
Reflects on himself as an average, unremarkable teenager without notable skills or achievements.
Calmly walks into school and interacts normally with his environment (waves to his father, joins line at metal detector).
Apologizes to Mrs. Zane politely when caught looking at her inappropriately
Acknowledges attraction to girls his own age honestly
Tries to clarify misunderstanding with Katie Deauxma and handles embarrassment without malice
Looks at teacher's chest instead of textbook; gets called out.
Quickly apologizes to teacher after being caught.
Misunderstands a social situation with Katie and Erika, tries to cover up awkwardness.
Acknowledges his own awkwardness and ordinariness.
Mourns his mother sincerely and vows to avenge her even though her death was natural, showing emotional depth and sincerity.
Reflects on life going on after his mother's death, showing acceptance and maturity.
Reflects morosely on his mother's sudden death and acknowledges that life goes on despite it.
Rages at the heavens in the graveyard, trying to find meaning or a cause to avenge.
Accepts movie tickets from his dad with enthusiasm, showing ability to appreciate small positive moments.
Questions why no one tries to be a superhero and expresses sincere curiosity about helping people.
Engages in lighthearted conversation and jokes with friends, showing friendliness and openness.
Expresses frustration that people idolize celebrities instead of heroes, showing idealism and sincerity.
Throws a bag of cocaine into the villain's face and escapes by jumping out a window despite injuries.
Unable to convincingly explain or deny accusations about involvement with the Russians, seems unsure and defensive.
Maintains honesty by denying false accusations despite pressure.
Shows confusion and surprise when confronted with conflicting information, indicating possible lack of control over the situation.
Pulls on a wet-suit and ski mask, strikes a superhero pose, and expresses self-encouragement with 'You are fucking awesome.'
Puts on a wetsuit and ski mask, looks in the mirror, and practices superhero poses and martial arts moves with confidence.
Keeps his new superhero activities secret from friends, does not share worries or seek support.
Attempts to fight crime despite lack of experience and frequent failures, shows earnestness and dedication.
Carefully treads the edge of the roof, checks he is not being watched before measuring the alley, attempts a rooftop leap as part of training.
Fails to land the leap between rooftops, indicating a lack of skill or preparation.
Commits time to physical training (pumping iron), showing dedication to improving physical competence.
Admits there wasn't much actual crime fighting, suggesting inexperience or limited effectiveness early on.
Uses a tape measure to gauge distances accurately, showing an intelligent, methodical approach.
Practices long-jumping repeatedly, showing persistence and preparation.
Stops at the edge of the roof instead of taking the leap, indicating hesitation or fear.
Waves goodbye to friends before riding off alone.
Keeps pedalling and looks away when noticing potential danger, then stops to take action.
Engages with potential muggers in his superhero costume without evident hostility or aggression in this excerpt.
Decides to stop fantasizing and take direct action by confronting potential danger in costume, demonstrating initiative and willingness to engage.
Slowly decreases speed and then halts before confrontation, indicating hesitation or uncertainty about the action ahead.
Chains bike securely before transforming into his costume, showing thoughtfulness and preparedness for what comes next.
Shows no visible sign of fear or retreat when approaching potentially dangerous gang members, walking confidently in full costume.
Confronts two gang kids vandalizing a car and tries to stop them peacefully by asking them to walk away from the car.
Uses violence (lead pipe) to defend himself after being attacked.
No intent to escalate conflict, tries to talk first, indicating sincerity and a good-natured attempt to prevent harm.
Confronts two gang kids vandalizing a car despite potential danger.
Carries a lead pipe in anticipation of trouble and uses it effectively to strike one attacker.
Underestimates the threat as he is stabbed by the first kid with a knife before realizing it.
Attempts to flag down a passing car for help after being stabbed but fails.
Recovers enough to stagger but doesn’t avoid a second oncoming car and gets hit.
Asks the medic not to tell anyone about his costume, showing concern for others and a desire to keep his identity safe.
Smiles with relief when the medic agrees to keep his secret, indicating trust and friendliness.
Smiles weakly when his father shows relief and kisses his forehead upon his recovery.
Comforts his crying father by patting him awkwardly on the back after a stressful moment.
Responds to the radiologist's concern with a brief apology, indicating some acknowledgment but limited emotional engagement.
Studies X-rays and jokes lightly about his injuries, showing some awareness and ability to cope with his situation.
Responds awkwardly to his father's emotional moment but tries to comfort him, showing some social awareness.
Confusedly denies any clear memory of his assault and the circumstances in which he was found, demonstrating gaps in his self-awareness and understanding.
Loads shopping bags into an SUV for a grateful young mom with a baby.
Paints over graffiti on a wall.
Puts on a new costume and sprints towards a rooftop gap, implying attempting a risky physical stunt.
Creates a personal MySpace page and uses a flattering selfie, suggesting some tech-savvy and self-presentation skills.
Paints over graffiti on a wall at night, demonstrating initiative and effort in a positive action.
Loads shopping bags for a grateful young mom while in costume, showing helpfulness and social engagement.
Stops older teens from cutting in line, protecting younger kids, resulting in cheers.
Searching for lost cat Mr. Bitey through neighborhood, despite being in costume and mocked.
Ignores potentially urgent situation of man being chased while focused on cat.
Leans in and stops the boy’s arm, successfully dispersing the older teens and letting the kids go first.
Stops at the edge of the roof instead of jumping or taking further decisive action.
Studies a poster about a lost cat, indicating careful attention and problem recognition.
Walks the neighborhood searching for the cat despite ridicule from passersby.
Spots the cat, sprints towards it dodging traffic, and attempts to catch it by climbing a tree.
Fails to notice the man in trouble nearby while focusing on the cat.
Intervenes to protect Oscar from being beaten by three gang members.
Shouts to bystanders to call 911 during the fight.
Checks on Oscar’s wellbeing after the fight.
Slips and falls while trying to reach the cat, accidentally knocking down Oscar.
Tries to intervene in a violent situation despite being overpowered and initially ineffective.
Uses a lead pipe to fight back aggressively and lands plenty of hits.
Shouts for bystanders to call 911, showing awareness and presence of mind.
Fights to protect Oscar despite being outnumbered and injured.
Stops fighting when opponents flee after noticing the crowd, demonstrating tactical awareness.
Leans in closer to hear Oscar's response after helping him
Runs away to avoid being seen after a fight, then retrieves his clothes and checks himself in the mirror
Grins despite being bruised and bleeding, showing satisfaction for helping
Responds 'I'm Kickass' to a bystander's question after helping Oscar
Becomes an internet phenomenon and recognized for intervening in a gang-related attack.
Knows how to maintain a Kickass MYSPACE page and manage his online persona effectively.
Receives positive social recognition but still seems nervous or unsure when interacting with media or public attention (implied from Oscar's nervousness and fan reactions).
Engages in casual conversation with his dad about Kick-Ass on TV, showing openness and some sincere interest.
Does not dismiss or mock Mindy's enthusiasm about Kick-Ass, maintaining a neutral/friendly stance.
Is mostly a passive observer during others' negative or mocking comments about Kick-Ass, does not join in with hostility or sarcasm.
Argues in defense of vigilantes helping people, showing empathy for victims.
Jokes about taser colors being 'gay', showing insensitivity and stereotyping.
Reassures his dad he will be careful, expressing concern for his father's feelings.
Replies to multiple MySpace help requests, showing willingness to assist others.
Struggles with how to sign off his message, ultimately choosing an informal but friendly tone.
Discussions with father about carrying a taser; ultimately agrees to choose a practical option (camo).
Shows social media presence and attempts to respond to multiple requests for help, indicating organizational effort.
Hesitates and second-guesses himself when signing off messages, erasing multiple versions before settling on an informal sign-off.
Initially dismisses taser colors as 'gay' and associates them with girls, showing immaturity in judgment.
Expresses to his father not to worry about him, which may reflect avoidance of parental concern but also confidence in his own choices.
Responds kindly and appreciatively to Katie's friendly gesture and accepts her invitation to meet for coffee despite his initial wariness.
Feels euphoric and excited after interaction with Katie, showing genuine emotional openness.
Listens to negative and judgmental comments from Todd and Marty about Katie without challenging or defending her.
Responds defensively but engages with friends amid rumors.
Shows gratitude to Katie for bringing him a drink despite awkwardness.
Reacts with polite surprise and interest to the success and expanded community around Kick-Ass.
Defends himself against rumors and misconceptions, tries to clarify the truth calmly.
Reacts with surprise and awe at the changes in the comic store and promotional material.
Appears stunned and unsure when confronted with new social situations, e.g., meeting Katie and dealing with teasing.
Tries to lighten the mood when Katie is upset, makes a joke to ease tension.
Offers to give a guy's perspective and listens attentively when Katie shares her struggles.
Accepts Katie's hand squeeze and remains supportive.
Attempts to hide his own despair and avoids fully sharing his feelings.
Attempts to engage Katie in conversation and makes a light joke to ease tension.
Tries to offer support but struggles to hide his own despair, showing some social awkwardness.
Confronts Rasul to warn him to stay away from Katie, showing concern for her safety.
Threatens physical violence if Rasul does not leave Katie alone.
Uses a taser on Rasul to protect himself and enforce his warning.
Freezes in shock witnessing Mindy kill Rasul, showing a lack of control or readiness.
Confronts dangerous thugs alone and delivers a warning to Rasul about Katie.
Uses a taser to incapacitate Rasul quickly, showing some tactical thinking.
Attempts to reload taser under physical attack but fails to escape or overcome restraint.
Freezes in shock when Mindy intervenes, showing lack of confidence or presence of mind in high stress.
Lowers taser when Mindy reassures him; reluctantly shakes her bloody hand.
Follows Mindy up the fire escape despite fear and reluctance.
Gives awkward wave to Damon after Mindy introduces him.
Freezes in shock and terror, unable to act during fight.
Slams on brakes in terror rather than attempting the risky jump.
Pulls off his blood-spattered mask, curls up into a ball and starts to cry, showing vulnerability and emotional openness.
Compares himself negatively to Hitgirl and Big Daddy, calling himself 'just a stupid dick in a wetsuit'.
Expresses gratitude to Mindy and Damon for picking up taser cartridges and rerouting his IP despite their mistrust
Nods frantically and tries to assure Mindy and Damon he hasn’t told anyone about them, showing honest and sincere fear
Considers shutting down his site and quitting due to feeling overwhelmed, showing self-awareness and humility
Initially doesn’t secure evidence properly (leaves taser cartridges behind), shows lack of foresight.
Recognizes vulnerability and is honest about being in over his head, shows self-awareness.
Responds nervously and submissively to Mindy and Damon, lacking confidence in high-pressure situation.
Graciously accepts help and acknowledges others' potential, demonstrating openness to learning.
Responds appreciatively and humors Damon’s comment with kindness.
Nods confusedly to Damon’s offer of help but does not reject it.
Compliments Katie sincerely on her dress despite awkwardness.
Tries to maintain respectful behavior around Katie despite temptation.
Nods when given unclear instructions, showing confusion but willingness to cooperate.
Manages to maintain composure around Katie Deauxma despite awkwardness and attraction.
Is confused by the gravitas of the situation (murder, superheroes breaking in), indicating limited understanding of severity.
Responds supportively and politely to Katie’s fashion show, showing social skills and emotional intelligence.
Walks confidently in public as Kickass, seemingly oblivious to the threat following him.
Spends the weekend watching TV shows and doing pedicures instead of taking initiative to resolve personal issues with Katie.
Recognizes the need to tell Katie his feelings but hesitates because he doesn’t find the right time.
Remains calm and sociable when Katie arrives unexpectedly, responding politely to her affection.
Engages in casual conversation with friends about Red Mist and the police taking down a drug dealer.
No dismissive or negative comments toward Red Mist or others praising him; participates in friendly group interaction.
Expresses frustration privately (throws soda can hard), showing personal vulnerability but not directing anger at others.
Responds to Red Mist's injury with concern ('Are you okay?').
Engages respectfully with Chris (Red Mist), shaking hands and accepting sidekick offer.
Fuming at Red Mist's popularity but continues to check Kick-Ass site and emails carefully.
Throws a can of soda harder than necessary out of frustration.
Responds cautiously entering the alleyway in costume, showing situational awareness.
Surprised and unsure when Red Mist offers to be his sidekick, indicating some lack of confidence.
Follows Chris despite reservations, shows willingness to engage in crime fighting.
Jokes about his crime fighting schedule, indicating some hesitation and lack of serious planning.
Buckles seatbelt and stays alert during Chris' reckless driving, showing practical awareness.
Expresses surprise and confusion about Chris's unorthodox behavior, suggesting uncertainty.
Agrees to check out a potentially dangerous situation with little information and preparation.
Runs into a burning warehouse to help despite obvious danger, attempts to drag the unconscious huge goon out.
Shows hesitation about entering the burning building and initially considers calling for help instead.
Attempts to drag the Huge Goon to safety despite difficulty
Screams, drops the Huge Goon, and runs away upon seeing his horrific wounds
Calls out to his partner Red Mist to help escape the fire
Expresses horror at the dead bodies and the violent scene
Is concerned and curious about why Chris saved the burnt teddy bear
Leaves the scene quickly without rescuing anyone from the fire
Takes a calculated precaution by grabbing his gun when the doorbell rings persistently
Involves himself in a dangerous and confusing situation without fully understanding it
Expresses fear and reluctance to get involved in dangerous crime fighting.
Remains oblivious to and awkwardly waves at the girls, not engaging in their flirtations.
Refuses to share what he suspects about the killings.
Shows hesitation and discomfort in social/romantic interaction situations.
Politely but firmly rejects the brunette's sexual advances and quickly excuses himself, showing self-control and a clear sense of purpose.
Appears surprised and unsure initially when the brunette expresses attraction, indicating some social awkwardness and lack of confidence.
Attempts to enter Katie's house to talk to her, trying to be cool and friendly despite the situation.
Repeatedly tells Katie he is not going to hurt her and tries to calm her down.
Allows Katie to hit him with a bottle of body mist without retaliating, showing restraint and non-violent behavior.
Pulls off his mask to reveal himself and de-escalate conflict, showing sincerity and transparency.
Breaks into Katie's house uninvited, disregarding her boundaries and causing fear.
Attempts to quietly enter Katie's room at night by climbing through the window.
Leans against the dresser trying to appear cool and confident.
Speaks to Katie but fails to realize she's not paying attention; has to raise his voice.
Fails to anticipate Katie's hostile reaction (spraying body mist in his eyes and swinging a tennis racquet).
Attempts to reason and calm Katie down despite being attacked.
Pulls off his mask to reveal his identity to stop Katie from hitting him with a bat.
Apologizes sincerely for being a bad friend, admits faults, expresses deep regret and admiration for Katie
Responds hopefully and vulnerably to Katie's invitation to stay, shares an intimate moment
Shows affectionate and playful behavior towards Katie, inviting her to a movie and enjoying intimate moments together.
Engages in friendly banter with friends Todd and Marty, showing openness and sociability.
Successfully initiates and arranges a spontaneous date to see a movie with Katie, showing social confidence and decisiveness.
Engages in a sexual encounter enthusiastically, displaying emotional openness and positive personal development.
Engages in a sincere and caring phone conversation with Katie, expressing mutual care and concern.
Keeps promise to Katie by apparently giving up Kick-Ass days and avoids getting hurt, showing consideration for her worries.
Minimizes excitement about Kick-Ass activities, reflecting a more reserved and responsible attitude.
Wears a duffle-coat over his costume and does not wear a mask, revealing himself and indicating openness.
Expresses concern about the seriousness of the situation and the promise made to his girlfriend to quit being Kick-Ass.
Attempts to calm Chris down despite the panic about the threats on their lives (says 'Dude... Calm down.')
Uses his cell phone to check the Kickass webpage, showing responsibility and prudence.
Sobbing while tied up, showing vulnerability and emotional openness.
No sign of aggression or resentment towards captors; displays emotional distress rather than hostility.
Sobbing while tied up, showing emotional distress in a dangerous situation.
Maintains composure less than Damon who is calm, indicating less emotional control under pressure.
Reflects on the pain of physical injury but more on the emotional pain of potentially leaving loved ones behind and missing future experiences with them.
Accepts help from Mindy without complaint after traumatic events.
Engages in nervous conversation by asking Mindy her real name, showing a desire for connection.
Removes his mask, revealing vulnerability and sincerity.
Remains tied up and needs to be untied by Mindy, admits he can’t drive.
Successfully survives a dangerous situation and stays alive despite the chaos around him.
Relies on Mindy for driving and escape.
Attempts to converse and establish connection after traumatic event, showing presence of mind.
Refuses to leave Mindy alone until he knows she is okay, expressing a sense of responsibility and care.
Acknowledges his debt to Mindy for saving him and vows to look after her, showing sincerity and trustworthiness.
Tries to encourage Mindy to call an important contact but respects her wish to delay, showing tolerance and patience.
Refuses to leave Mindy alone until he is sure she is okay, showing responsibility and care.
Suggests calling the number given by Mindy's dad, demonstrating problem-solving skills.
Tries to figure out what to tell his dad to cover up the situation, indicating basic planning ability.
Expresses uncertainty and hesitation in conversation, showing some emotional struggle.
Does not immediately insist Mindy call the number or take more proactive steps, deferring to her wishes.
Tries to stop Mindy from risking herself alone, expressing concern for her safety.
Acknowledges the gravity of the situation quietly, showing empathy and sadness.
Does not try to assert control or dominance; listens to Mindy and respects her decision despite misgivings.
Expresses concern about Mindy going out alone and acknowledges the seriousness of the situation, showing some situational awareness.
Fumbles with understanding the scale of Mindy’s plans and security measures, showing limited readiness or understanding.
Reluctantly prepares himself by picking up his coat and mask, showing willingness but hesitance.
Does not immediately rush into action; takes a moment to assess the situation and his gear.
Does not contest Mindy’s warnings or led the plan, passively follows rather than takes initiative.
Expresses deep sorrow and helplessness about being unable to bring someone's father back. Apologizes sincerely to Hit Girl.
Shrugs helplessly when insulted by Mindy, does not retaliate or react with anger.
Reflects on his limited abilities but acknowledges his good intentions.
Puts on his mask and runs toward danger despite uncertainty, demonstrating commitment.
Shrugs helplessly and admits he can’t do what’s needed, apologizing to Hit Girl.
Reflects on his own limitations honestly, acknowledging he only has good intentions and not real power.
Pulls on his mask and starts running, showing renewed determination despite doubts.
Jumps from rooftop edge, risking a jump no one could realistically make, indicating impulsiveness.
Uses jet pack to save himself mid-fall, successfully flying after a dangerous jump.
Smashes through glass and opens fire to save Mindy and take down enemies.
Smiles warmly at Mindy after rescuing her, sharing a moment of connection.
Calls a police contact to get help for Mindy despite the risks.
Watches a fight between Mindy and Frank, frozen and hesitant to intervene.
Tries to de-escalate conflict by telling Chris he has a choice and doesn't have to follow his father's example.
Puts hands up immediately when police arrive, showing compliance and avoidance of unnecessary conflict.
Allows himself to be grabbed and escape with Mindy, showing trust in her although she has just threatened Chris.
Promises to look out for Mindy at school, shows concern when she is threatened
Acknowledges Mindy with a handshake after revealing identities, showing mutual respect
Waves goodbye to his father before school, indicating a friendly and open demeanor
Waves greetings warmly to Phil, a new friend introduced by Katie; rests his head on Katie's shoulder, showing contentment and affection
Thoughtfully reflects on the changes around him and acknowledges others’ inspirations without boasting
Questions why no one has ever tried to be a real-life superhero, showing curiosity and willingness to think beyond common assumptions.
Engages in a discussion about superheroes but seems naive about practical dangers and complexities involved.
Compares people’s unrealistic aspirations (e.g. wanting to be rockstars) to the lack of people trying to be heroes, indicating insight into human behavior and societal trends.
Fails to recognize the practical obstacles and risks involved in acting as a real superhero beyond just putting on a mask.
Writes superhero names and doodles of himself in costume, including 'Kick Ass' with question marks, showing planning and creativity.
Slips on jeans and long-sleeved tee over costume and leaves for school, indicating preparation and confidence to engage as a hero.
Not paying attention in class, distracted by thoughts of being a superhero, indicating a lack of focus on immediate responsibilities.
Asks the medic not to tell anybody about the costume, showing awareness of consequences and desire for privacy.
Ends up severely injured and unconscious, indicating poor situational awareness or lack of skill in avoiding harm.
Slams on the brakes in terror at the last moment when facing a dangerous rooftop jump
Acknowledges that Hitgirl and Big Daddy are the real deal while seeing himself as just a 'stupid dick'
Climbs shakily down the fire escape to the street
Sits down heavily on the bed, removes mask, curls up and cries
Comforts Katie as she sobs, puts arm around her shoulder, offers to cheer her up with candy and magazines.
Guiltily relishes Katie's hug, hesitates before responding to her comment about him being gay.
Is attacked and beaten unconscious by Frank without putting up effective resistance.
Survives an apparent shooting and is later shown comforting Katie, demonstrating emotional support and presence of mind.
Attempts to reassure Katie realistically and calmly, despite difficult circumstances.
Guiltily relishes Katie’s need for comfort, indicating some opportunistic self-involvement.
Asks questions about Red Mist's actions and reacts to others' opinions.
Follows Chris despite initial hesitation, shows willingness to engage in crime fighting together.
Polite and engages with Chris’s enthusiasm (comments on the car, buckles up, responds to invitation).
Maintains some distance and humor (notes limited crime fighting hours, protests initially).
Runs into a burning warehouse to help people inside despite the danger.
Struggles to drag an unconscious enemy out of the burning warehouse, showing concern for others regardless of their role.
Politely pushes the brunette off and excuses himself despite her advances, showing respect and consideration.
Freezes in shock when Hit Girl is shot, showing emotional response to violence against an ally.
Does not react violently or aggressively to the attack, appears vulnerable and overwhelmed.
Follows Damon and Chris into the safehouse and cooperates quietly.
Smashes through glass to make a dramatic entrance and fires machine guns at enemies, successfully taking down remaining goons.
Continues firing despite being knocked on his back, showing persistence under pressure.
Throws down guns after running out of bullets and immediately follows Mindy, showing situational awareness and teamwork.
Explains calling the police contact but underestimates the consequences as Mindy reveals the contact is actually an enemy.
Watches the fight between Mindy and Frank frozen and does not intervene when he might help.
Is restrained by Chris and unable to act, indicating a lack of control over the situation.
Recognizes that his actions inspired others to become superheroes, showing some insight and acceptance of impact.
Is content resting his head on Katie’s shoulder, showing emotional comfort but no active competence.
Reflects that he only made a door into a world he dreamed about, implying self-awareness of his role and limits.
